main event: A radar observation of a light with an irregular flight path over Fairfield, Connecticut on June 25, 1963.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes with a single object observed., The object flew from the west to the east without producing any sound., The speed of the object was estimated to be 2-3 times that of a commercial jet., A separate note referred to a white triangular object sighted at night., The object was initially observed at an altitude of 30,000-40,000 feet.
sighted object: a light with an irregular flight path
witness description: a civilian who reported the sighting
